My hubby and I created HOMESCHOOLOPOLY® a homeschool board game, and I am the author of: "Homeschooling | The Journey is The Reward".   My husband is a software genius and the breadwinner of the family.  The majority of our income comes from his side of the business: Berthume Software.   
www.berthume.com
www.homeschoolopoly.com

lenders.name: NANA
lenders.loan_because: As a traditional ruler in a rural community, I need to see to it that my people get better living, more especially the youth to become employable. This can work properly by providing them with small loans as a start up capital.
lenders.occupational_info: This activity helps to reduce rural - urban migration, teenage pregnancy, armed robbery and unemployment rate. As a traditional ruler and Accountant as well, I provide them with financial management and entrepreneurial skills that enable them to work properly with the money given to them and return it in due time . I also make sure that there is no bad debt in the system.In order to let enough people enjoy this special strtegy, I need a little support for expansion to cover a wide area. Any lender may join it without fear.

lenders.name: Adonicus
lenders.loan_because:
Wine of Omar Khayyám
  Eugene Lee-Hamilton

  He rode the flame-winged dragon-steed of Thought
    Through Space and Darkness, seeking Heaven and Hell;
    And searched the furthest stars where souls might dwell
  To find God's justice: and in vain he sought.

  Then, looking on the dusk-eyed girl who brought
    His dream-filled wine beside his garden-well,
    He said: "Her kiss; the wine-jug's drowsy spell;
  Bulbul; the roses; death; ... all else is naught:

  So drink till that." -- What, drink, because the abyss
    Of Nothing waits? because there is for man
  But one swift hour of consciousness and light?

  No, -- just because we have no life but this,
    Turn it to use; be noble while you can;
  Search, help, create; then pass into the night.

lenders.name: neil
lenders.loan_because: For my albums.
lenders.occupational_info: It's so Nice.

lenders.name: Dominic
lenders.loan_because:
I focus on lending for arable farming.

In order to discover suitable borrowers I wrote a program which searches all current Kiva loans every 5 minutes and looks for new loans which meet my criteria, and when they do sends me an email and sms. Others use it too. It is more powerful than Kiva's auto-lend criteria.

I am happy to provide it to anyone else who is interested!

lenders.name: Petunia

Kevin & Diana,
to celebrate not only their engagement, 
but also their friendship.  
Congrats and thanks bunches!

lenders.occupational_info: I am currently a high school student trying to get all my high school credits to get into college. I run track for my high school and i play basketball for a recreational team. lenders.name: Anqi
lenders.loan_because: You can give a man a fish, or you can teach him how to fish. I believe in the power of small business run by the individual, for the individual, not only to build a sustainable living, but also to stimulate an entire community's economy. I want to share what I have with those who need and deserve it the most.
lenders.occupational_info: By training, I am an electrical engineer, but currently I am pursuing graduate studies in business economics. I study how market transactions occur and recommend government policies to improve the way goods are distributed. Eventually, I hope to start my own business. In my free time, I love to read, write stories, and draw.

lenders.name: Scott

lenders.occupational_info: I deal with the design and construction of the physical environment.

lenders.name: Derek
lenders.loan_because: I want to see people do well

lenders.name: Ellie
lenders.loan_because: I believe in microfinance: it brings poor people out of a key expolitative cycle often involving powerful local moneylenders. It empowers people and supports self-determination. It starts off small and becomes bigger.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with Australian Indigenous and non-Indigenous people on land issues, and land use and land management planning by groups, communities  and individuals; supporting sustainable economies, empowering local people.

lenders.name: Gleyenna
lenders.loan_because: I get great pleasure seeing people (specially family and friends) succeed in their craft or profession.

lenders.name: Kaelyn Forde
lenders.loan_because: My experience within Asian and Latin American developing nations has been that poverty and the despair it creates are endless until a functioning civil society can be established. The chronically undernourished, the illiterate and the ethnically marginalized cannot build economic, civil and democratic institutions. A strong, efficacious middle class has historically demanded the environmental, educational, political, economic, civil and judicial reforms that many countries so desperately need. It develops human capital, empowers women and families and sustains entire communities. I first became interested in micro-finance while working as a correspondent in Cambodia; I saw land mine amputees and Khmer Rouge veterans regain their dignity and independence by selling books rather than begging.
lenders.occupational_info: I aspire to work as a trilingual foreign correspondent in Latin America for an international television news network. I will also write, shoot, edit and produce a documentary accompaniment to my honors thesis, coalescing my dual degrees in Broadcast Journalism and International Relations. I believe film brings us closer than words can.

lenders.name: Teo and Melissa
lenders.loan_because: We are making a personal investment to help enrich people's lives and eliminate poverty.

lenders.name: Matt
lenders.loan_because: To share the resources I've been given.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: I support local, indigenous knowledge.
lenders.occupational_info: I try to find ways that support people's motivation to live happy, healthy, and productive lives.

lenders.name: Elisabeth
lenders.loan_because:
I loan because everyone deserves to be able to make a living, and if that means me or other people having to help them out a bit, well then I'll do it. The point in life to enjoy yourself, and when you don't have money in a world that revolves around money, then people with enough should help those who don't have enough enjoy their life. You only have one life so you better enjoy it while you can!
                         -Elisabeth

lenders.name: Roni

lenders.name: Adventures with the Estrogen Army
lenders.occupation: Adventure Divas with a Better World Bent
lenders.loan_because: We want to give people a chance to become self-sufficient and live an honourable life. We believe that a hand up is better than a hand out, and that it needs to be both transparent and accountable. We believe that planting many seeds of uplift in small and meaningful ways helps people become self-sustaining and strengthens both the economic and social fabric of communities. Micro-lending is the most direct and personal form of uplift and has the capacity for constant renewal.
lenders.occupational_info: "Adventures with the Estrogen Army" is a project for and by ordinary women who want to create extraordinary adventures.  In doing so we are committed to giving a hand up to our sister adventure divas around the world who are working to lift themselves up out of poverty and violence.  Kiva is one of the ways we choose to do this, and to give back.

lenders.name: Kelly
lenders.loan_because: I am also an entrepreneur and want to help others who are working hard to support their family.  It takes so little to help so much.
lenders.occupational_info: I make organic, environmentally conscious body products including lotion, bug spray, dog shampoo, body scrubs and lip treatments.

lenders.name: Mitch
lenders.loan_because: I am interested in helping less fortunate people live a better life

lenders.name: Bandegolus/DRRGLPAD
lenders.loan_because: We are international students who want to positvely impact the global economy. As economic students we believe in giving people the opportunity to help themselves

lenders.name: Sue Braiden
lenders.loan_because:
I want to give people a chance to become self-sufficient and live an honourable life.

I believe that a hand up is better than a hand out, and that it needs to be both transparent and accountable.

I believe that planting many seeds of uplift in small and meaningful ways helps people become self-sustaining and strengthens both the economic and social fabric of communities. Micro-lending is the most direct and personal form of uplift and has the capacity for constant renewal.
lenders.occupational_info:
This started out as a personal account in which I invested a percentage of my sales income into people through microloans through a few online projects.  

In 2008 I began inviting customers and friends to join me in creating a little uplift here at Kiva, which resulted in investing in the first 50 entrepreneurs during the first year.  

Since that time the money has been reinvested to support more than 300 entrepreneurs.  I continue to invite people to join me in creating a little uplift in these lives through our "Giving Tree" group (link at the bottom of this page).

Namaste,
Sue.

lenders.name: Schultz

lenders.occupational_info: Risk mitigation/crisis management for a financial institution. I also run a small business on Ebay selling handbags and other accessories.
